description: When Kai goes undercover with Section 2, he falls into real danger when he is separated from the rest of the unit. He ends up in dark room full of suspicious characters, one of whom has the brand of a Ryugen slave. Now Section 2 must race to find him before it's too late.
name: Vol. 9

description: When Hal comes under suspicion in the death of a girl, his reputation and his sanity both begin to crack. His partners discover that Hal may also have a past connection to the drug Switch. Now the NCD has to decide whether Hal is one of them or a traitor in their midst.
name: Vol. 10

description: The inmates at the ASYLUM continue with a new breed of horror. This anthology features "Jacked In" by Frank Forte where a programmer gets double crossed by a greedy girlfriend and he gets his sweet revenge. Part 1 of Tim Vigil's new "Survival Extinction Z" a post apocalyptic horror tale (with Joe Vigil and Jeff Vigil). Part 2 of "Ruined Earth", Billy George's tale of giant worms and armageddon. In "Ecce Homo" by Darren Sellars and Patrick Shanahan, a race of creatures, almost machine-like in their brutal efficiency break free from the confines of a two-dimensional world and begin a relentless assault, wiping any and all resistance from its path. In " Transformation" by Marcin Ponomarew, a desperate man takes an injection. In "The Connection" a mad doctor tries to find the source of another voice inside his head, by Forte. Another tale of The Doctor and Boris and the horrid inmates. A great collection of disturbing tales for the discerning horror fan. Cover by Aly fell.

A mystical artifact from the ancient past, the relic known only as the Mask imbues its wearer with nearly limitless power . . . face-stretching, mallet-forming, clock-smashing power. Slap the Mask on your mug and nothing is beyond your reach-or the reach of a pie bomb-which is why every crook, grifter, creep, hood, miscreant, scofflaw, and other words in the thesaurus are out to get their mitts on it. The hunt for the valued vizard (thanks again, thesaurus!) goes from sea to shining sea, involving voodoo, Amazonian tribesmen, ninjas (sweet!), mafiosi, Crypto-Nazis . . . and the Bardard Thespian Club!

Collects

  • The Mask: Hunt for Green October #1-4
  • The Mask: World Tour #1-4
  • The Mask: Southern Discomfort #1-4
  • Night of the Return of the Living Ipkiss...Kinda
  • The Mask: Toys in the Attic #1-4
name: Volume 2

description:
Hardworking Hayate has a plan to pay back the yakuza--who are now the legal owners of his body parts: he'll kidnap someone and ransom them for a mountain of money! But things get tricky when his would-be kidnappee--who as luck would have it is the daughter of a mind-bogglingly wealthy family--mistakes Hayate's actions for a confession of love, and subsequently hires him to be her personal servant. At least his employment future is secure, or so he thinks...

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: Santa's Red Is a Blood-Colored Hell
  • Episode 2: In English, 'Unmei' Means 'Destiny'
  • Episode 3: Observation of the Current State of Affairs and the Structure of the Maid Outfit
  • Episode 4: Nagi Sanzenin and Her Chamber of Secrets
  • Episode 5: Even if You Become a Newtype, Silence Is a Virtue
  • Episode 6: Good Children Shouldn't Copy This!! No, Even Bad Children and Adults Shouldn't Copy This Either, Not Ever!
  • Episode 7: Won't Be Crying Out Love in the Center of the World, but in Other Words, the Beast Reigning at the Top of the Hierarchy
  • Episode 8: Hellbound with Neko-mimi Mode
  • Episode 9: In The Language of Flowers, the St. John's Wort Fully Blooming in the Flower Garden Means 'Vengeance'
name: Vol. 1

description:
Hayate's new career as a live-in butler for the mega-moneyed Sanzenin family is in full swing, but this job requires more than just mental fortitude and brute strength--he needs to be entertaining too. Whether it's standing up to fire-spewing robots or protecting his mistress's millions from her tycoon grandfather, Hayate must remain calm, composed, and hilarious at all times. The question now is whether Hayate will actually live long enough to pay off his debts...and things aren't looking too good!

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: In the Wee Hours of a Full Moon Night, Roasting, Smashing and Grinding Them to Powder
  • Episode 2: The Mystery of Men Playing Shogi All the Time at the Foot of the Tsutenkaku Tower
  • Episode 3: The New "Run Towards Our Sun!"
  • Episode 4: Quest of the Avatar
  • Episode 5: How Much Is Your Life?
  • Episode 6: A Way to Lose the Golden Feather
  • Episode 7: Careless Kindness Brings Unhappiness
  • Episode 8: Bad Ending Flags in All Directions
  • Episode 9: Even a Fool Catches Cold, So Please Help Me, Nurse Angel. I'm Not Finished Yet!!
  • Episode 10: Night of the Servants
  • Episode 11: When I Turned, I Remembered That Was the Beginning of Unhappiness
name: Vol. 2

description:
As if dealing with his mistress Nagi's outlandish demands weren't taxing enough, poor (yet perennially) hardworking Hayate has to suffer the ignominy of being challenged to a duel by Nagi's fiancé Wataru Tachibana. With his saber at the ready, Hayate is prepared to defend himself...but is there any logical reason why he's even fighting a duel in the first place? Shouldn't the simple act of keeping the Sanzenin household spic-and-span be enough?

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: A Battle for Men
  • Episode 2: The Tokyo Underground
  • Episode 3: The Kingdom of Ambition
  • Episode 4: I Lost My Temper and Did It Because I Was Mortified About Losing to Little Kids on the Street. But, I Have No Regrets
  • Episode 5: A Nuisance, Even for Peter Pan
  • Episode 6: Who Came Up with the Sound Effect, "Kapok"? It's Awesome
  • Episode 7: I Never Had the Problem of Being Too Popular
  • Episode 8: I Wanted to See the Challenge of the Super Shuffle
  • Episode 9: By the Time Ojo-sama Cries
  • Episode 10: Wavering Hearts
  • Episode 11: I'm Hoping My Voice Will Reach You
name: Vol. 3

description:
For full-time butler-in-debt Hayate, attending high school--even one tailor-made for his working class values--remains just a dream inside a dream, but the ritzy Hakuou Gakuin seems galaxies beyond his reach, especially since it's packed with the wealthiest students in Japan! Despite that, and in order to be a first-class butler, Hayate remains resolute in his desire to get an education, even if his new duties involve transporting his mistress's forever forgotten-at-home box lunch to class!

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: Hayate the Combat Butler
  • Episode 2: If This Were an Anime, the Opening Would Change!
  • Episode 3: If the Teacher Told You to Die, Would You?!
  • Episode 4: Fools, Smoke and Cats... No One Wants to Climb Up to High Places
  • Episode 5: A Power That Won't Revolutionize the World
  • Episode 6: A Long Time Ago, Space Sheriff Gyaban Taught Us that Youth Is About Not Turning Back!
  • Episode 7: The One Who Controls Summer Seems to Control the Entrance Exam
  • Episode 8: Funny Bunny
  • Episode 9: The First Class Likes Curry
  • Episode 10: Samurai, Bushido and Moving Van Damme
  • Extra Episode: Radical Dreamers
name: Vol. 4

description:
To truly be considered a butler of the highest caliber, Hayate needs more than just punctuality, an unwavering sense of loyalty and the ability to keep his mistress out of tight situations--he'll also need to develop the ultimate fighting technique! Despite his best efforts at avoiding violent confrontations, our butler-in-debt seems incapable of keeping out of duels. Thankfully, this time it's a non-life-threatening kendo match. Will the path of the sword help guide Hayate toward true domestic enlightenment?

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: Defeated, but Still Fighting
  • Episode 2: I Won't Forget You Were the Voice Actor in Art of Fighting
  • Episode 3: Arrested for Breaking a Window at the School at Night
  • Episode 4: Elohim Essaim, Lets Recite a Charm!!
  • Episode 5: Mr.Cow, Mr. Cow! - What Is It, Mr. Frog?
  • Episode 6: I Like Reading Books, but I Don't Know How to Make Use of Them
  • Episode 7: Let's Sing at Ryugujo
  • Episode 8: Saki-san's Ambition [Whole Country Version]
  • Episode 9: Raging Waves
  • Episode 10: Titanic Episode 4 - With a Vengeance
  • Episode 11: Nagi - Andalusia's Winter
name: Vol. 5

description:
With a prize of 150 million yen on the line, the traditional sports event at Hakuou Gakuin--the paired freestyle marathon--finally begins. Honor, pride, and even the fate of Hayate's employment are on the line, but how can he hope to win when his mistress Nagi would sooner French-kiss a king cobra than participate in anything remotely close to exercise?! What cruel mishap will befall the embattled Hayate this time--especially when victory is but a short jog away?

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: Give it Your Best, Nagi's - Special Training
  • Episode 2: It's Up to the Runner to Win the Race...
  • Episode 3: Like 'Run Jolie' ... Too-roo-roo...
  • Episode 4: Tigers of Money
  • Episode 5: Many Kids Must Be in Trouble Since Train_Man Showed Their Parents What Comiket Is All About
  • Episode 6: Distance
  • Episode 7: Ba-bump☆ My Butler Is My Idol?! The New Shojo Manga Series, Episode 1
  • Episode 8: One Who Is Darkness Beyond Twilight, I Will Turn You More Crimson Than Flowing Blood
  • Episode 9: The Vagabond's Ordeal — The Mysterious Dungeon for Dropout Butlers
  • Episode 10: Hayate and the Colossus
  • Episode 11: And It Won't Be a Legend
name: Vol. 6

description:
Valentine's Day is coming--a time for boys and girls to share their heartfelt sentiments with one another and to revel in the glories of young love. Ayumu, a former classmate of Hayate, has kept a flame burning for the adorably overworked butler for some time. Is her chance for true happiness with a horrendously debt-ridden domestic finally at hand? Later, Nagi applies for her school's manga award but quickly learns that if her work is to be tempered with worldly experience, she'll need to get her upper-class hands dirty--both literally and figuratively.

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: Maria-san's Honey-Sweet Lesson... with Poison
  • Episode 2: It Was a Mission to Move Through Snow Fields, Like in That Game, D2
  • Episode 3: St. Valentine's Day: Classmate's Side — 'Shining☆ Days'
  • Episode 4: St. Valentine's Day: House Side - 'You Are Similar to Me'
  • Episode 5: There Are Things That Money Can't Buy. Priceless
  • Episode 6: The Genius Teacher Who Isn't a Little Kid Came to School
  • Episode 7: Go, Go Student Body Adventure
  • Episode 8: Devil Hunter Hospitable Isumi
  • Episode 9: It Was a More Serious Problem Than Conquering the World
  • Episode 10: Heart To Heart
  • Episode 11: My Sister is a First-Class Counselor
name: Vol. 7

description:
For reasons of no major concern or importance, butler-in-debt Hayate has to leave the Sanzenin mansion for a three-day, two-night trip. Though he has no particular place to go or reason to be there, Hayate does have one thing that's rarely in his possession: money (one million yen from Maria, to be exact). Well, he thought he had some money. Steering clear of gambling should be easy enough, but will cash-strapped classmates and impromptu medical bills leave Hayate's billfold as bleak and barren as his future?

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: Good, or Don't Be
  • Episode 2: Your Place
  • Episode 3: Nagi's Angels: Full Throttle
  • Episode 4: Elevator Action Was Beyond the Comprehension of Those of Us Who Couldn't Become Newtypes
  • Episode 5: Struggling with Jealousy!! Ja-pan
  • Episode 6: Running to Horizon
  • Episode 7: Round Dance -- Revolution --
  • Episode 8: Why Do I Always Watch Princess Mononoke on TV? I Own It on DVD...
  • Episode 9: Project Isumi ~ The Challengers ~ Tonight's Story Is About Ambitious Girls in Skirts
  • Episode 10: Please Save My Earth with a 130 cm Dandy, Darling
  • Episode 11: I Used to Think That It Was Normal to Fish Like the Crazy Old Men of the Sea
name: Vol. 8

description:
Hayate owes a debt of gratitude to Hinagiku--the cute, sporty, and all around perfect-in-every-conceivable-way student body president--and as her March 3rd birthday draws near, the bankrupt butler tries hard to come up with an appropriate present. But with final exams on the horizon, will he have time to prepare Hinagiku a heartfelt gift and pass his classes? Later, an ancient curse makes Hayate appear as if he's wearing women's clothing--and if it isn't broken, Hayate will be doomed to live out the rest of his days in drag! But, seeing as he looks really cute in a maid's uniform, maybe that isn't a bad thing...

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: Unpretty Woman
  • Episode 2: Riding a Mountain Bike ~ When I Went Shopping ~ I Realized That I Had No Wallet ~ But I Continued on Dating ~
  • Episode 3: Successful Mission
  • Episode 4: I Will
  • Episode 5: The Range of Questions You Predicted Won't Be on the Test
  • Episode 6: Moment
  • Episode 7: Around the Time of the Hina Doll Festival ~ Spirited Away by the Demon ~
  • Episode 8: The Magical Hayate Run-Run of Love
  • Episode 9: The Wise Old Man of Union Theope Says,`Love And Hate Are the Same Thing'
  • Episode 10: A Cruel, Foolish Man's Thesis
  • Episode 11: I Alone Am Honored in Heaven and on Earth
name: Vol. 9

description:
Final exams are close at hand and Hayate can no longer afford to ignore his studies, but if he's hitting the books, who will keep the Sanzenin mansion spick and span? Anticipating just such an occasion, head butler Klaus arranges for Mecha Butler No. 13 to take Hayate's place. Fully automated and machine-engineered to domestic perfection, this new cybernetic manservant boasts a wide variety of dazzling features and capabilities, from performing soothing backrubs to giving Nagi candid advice on her latest manga. Is Hayate truly this easy to replace?

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: Mind Education
  • Episode 2: The Heady Feeling of Freedom
  • Episode 3: Saki-san's Trifling Personal Errand (Warring Rival Episode)
  • Episode 4: Congratulations ☆ 100th Episode! But This Is Actually the 99th Week, Because Two Episodes Were Published the First Week...
  • Episode 5: You Don't Have Enough Kung Fu ♥
  • Episode 6: Well, Amuro Had a Place to Return to, But...
  • Episode 7: Once, Hotaru-chan Said, 'The One Who Takes Advantage of Others Will Be Taken Advantage of by Someone Else Someday...'
  • Episode 8: I Cried Out Loud on YOUR TUBE, and Now I Feel Great!
  • Episode 9: If You Feel Sorry for Me, Then Give Me Money, plus a PS3 and an Xbox 360
  • Episode 10: With All the Money You Spent on Sister Princess Merchandise, You Could Have Bought a Car
  • Episode 11: A Lonesome War
name: Vol. 10

description:
A meteor has fallen somewhere near the Izu Peninsula, an area well known for its relaxing hot spring resorts. The tourist trade is thrown into a tizzy when word leaks out that this meteor also seems to have imbued the local hot springs with cosmic powers, including (but not limited to) the ability to raise one's grades or increase one's bust size. Who in their right mind would let a divine opportunity like this slip by? Everyone, from butlers to their masters, are now booking their trips to Izu, so Hayate better pack his toothbrush--it's going to be a bumpy ride.

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: "© Gosho Aoyama"
  • Episode 2: "The Saginomiya Family"
  • Episode 3: "The Sanzenin Ranking Kingdom ~ Is Ralph a Mecha or a Monster? ~"
  • Episode 4: "Drop-Dead Chop!! And Kick & Punch!! And Finally, Uppercut"
  • Episode 5: "Longing for the Railway"
  • Episode 6: "When in Doubt, Just Paint it Red"
  • Episode 7: "Run! Even if You're Not an Honest Person"
  • Episode 8: "Run Together"
  • Episode 9: "It's More Like a Dream than Being in a Real Dream"
  • Episode 10: "Kiwa Kiwa Last Boy"
  • Episode 11: "The Moon Is a Harsh Ojō-sama at Night"
name: Vol. 11

description:
The Izu meteor may not have gifted Nagi with the pneumatic figure of her dreams, but it's left one surprise: a bug-eyed little alien girl looking for her lost spaceship. If Nagi helps she might score a biogenic reward, but will the grateful E.T. increase her bustline by 30 inches…or her distance from Hayate by 30 million miles? Then, before you know it, it's White Day, when guys in Japan repay girls for all the chocolate the girls gave on Valentine's Day. And Hayate thought the yakuza got cranky about unpaid debts…

Chapter Titles

  • Episode 1: "Nagi Sanzenin's Little Star Wars -Stardust Memory-"
  • Episode 2: "It Was Momoi Who Was Referred to as Having Skin like an Eggshell After a Bath"
  • Episode 3: "Goodbye, Mankind (Only Me)"
  • Episode 4: "Voices of a Distant Star"
  • Episode 5: "Someday... Please Believe"
  • Episode 6: "Just As Sp○der-Man Spends His Day Saving Human Lives Instead of Fighting Monsters like in the Movies, a Butler's Daily Life Is Much the Same"
  • Episode 7: "What's the Thing That Will Make You Happy, but You Don't Want to Buy for Yourself? Is It Hard to Find?"
  • Episode 8: "People Say if You Go There, You Can Make Any Kind of Cookies. Everyone Wants to Give Some, but the Meeting Place Is So Far"
  • Episode 9: "Butter-Fly"
  • Episode 10: "Future Century (Secret) Club"
  • Episode 11: "It Was like the Sound of Gill's Flute"
name: Vol. 12

description:
1. Full of Spirit!
 
2. The Eyes have It!
 
3. Laugh a Lot
 
4. [pinup]
 
5. Overexposed!
 
6. A Wise Bird!
 
7. Danny the Dino (Danny the Dino)
 
8. [activity page]
 
9. Interlude!
 
10. [activity page]
name: Full of Spirit!

description:
Stories include:


The Terrible Truth
The Way You Look Tonight
Love Me Forever!
But Is It Love?
The Long Wait
name: The Terrible Truth

description:
Set in the crummy under-crust of modern day Detroit, Unholy is the story of Penny, a stoner, rebel, teen who is a non-believer in God. After a fatal accident, she's drafted by God to be His assassin, a God she doesn't even believe in. As a fallen angel, she is caught in a shadow war waged on city streets, in plain clothes, between Heaven and Hell. With her new found allies, a dominatrix, an ex-mob hit man and an alcoholic priest, she is dumped into the front lines of the war for salvation. But can she even survive her first twenty fours hours as a newborn fallen? Get an inside look in this preview book featuring material not seen in the Pulido FCBD book including scripted pages, character designs, a cover gallery, an introduction by creator Brian Pulido, and more!

VariantCover ArtistltdRelease Date
regularDi Amorim September 2004
AngelicDi Amorim September 2004
wraparoundDi Amorim September 2004
PlatinumDi AmorimincentiveSeptember 2004
Pretty in PinkDi Amorim1500October 2004
Leather & LaceDi Amorim1500October 2004
name: Preview

description:
Our hero Vash the Stampede disappeared for two years after blasting a crater onto the moon above the desert planet he saved from annihilation. But with good people and bad alike trying to track him down, he won’t stay lost for long! Count on more crazy gunslinger action, new dastardly villains…and a new outfit, to boot!

Chapter Titles

  • Chapter 1: Hero Reborn
  • Chapter 2: Lina
  • Chapter 3: Girls, Bravo!
  • Chapter 4: Hero Returns
  • Chapter 5: Dancing Revolver
  • Chapter 6: Sin
name: Hero Returns

description: Note: Homage to Hawkman #6 cover.
name: Visitor's Day

description:
There are technically two stories in this book but they are essentially the same. It is a tribute to Julius (Julie) Schawrtz who is a character in the first story. If you read the cover you basically know what is going to happen. It is very silver age in the style of story telling.

Spoiler Warnings

In the first story takes place in February 1967. Julie is working late on a comic story at the expense of being home with his family. He is so tired he dozes off only to dream that the biggest superheros in DC are forcing him to work on their new comic. Julie in turn uses their powers or rather their weaknesses against them. It is after he defeats the heroes that they realize what they are doing and tell him to go home to his family

In the second story the Justice League goes back into time to save themselves from falling victim to the Time Lords who go back into time to destroy the Justice League while they are still rookies.
name: Secret Behind The Stolen Super=Weapons; Mayhem of the Mysterious Marauders

volume.name: DC Comics Presents: Justice League of America

description: Has two stories. One by Elliot S! Maggin and J. H. Williams III, one by Grant Morrison and Jerry Ordway. And inkers, letterers and colorists.
name: Crisis On 2 Worlds

volume.name: DC Comics Presents: Mystery in Space

description: Two short stories are contained in this comic, containing different art and writing styles. Both are re-imaginings of a old Superman story, by Julie Schwartz (which this book is in tribute too). In both Superman has a run in with the character Phantom Quarterback, but the character is very different in both stories, in fact the only thing that is the same is the look, powers and name. The first story is light hearted and is written by Stan Lee and the second is a little more mature which is written by Paul Levitz and Keith Giffen.
name: The Phantom Quarterback

description: Note: Homage of The Flash #163 cover.
name: The Fastest Man.. DEAD!

description:
Timothy Book is considered a big success amongst his peers – a high ranking job in banking, plush city apartment and trophy girlfriend to top it off. He’s on top of the world – until he crashes back down to earth with an almighty bang!

After a botched suicide attempt on the Thames, he turns up on the doorstep of ex-best-friend Cabbage, a streetwise busker, and is introduced to a side of life that he has never experienced. He falls deeper into the busking scene and is forced to re-evaluate his former existence, friendships and relationships, while embarking on an eventful journey back to the real Timothy Book.
name: Buskers

description:
The X-Men and the Fantastic Four team up with the help of Pat Lee and Dreamwave Studios in this heart-pounding limited series! Can the X-Men and the Fantastic Four put their differences aside to stop a creeping menace from outer space that threatens our planet’s very existence?! Join megawatt creator Pat Lee and writer Akira Yoshida (THOR: SON OF ASGARD) for mutant meyham and fantastic fights!

Outer space, The Simulacra- The crew of the Simulacra retrieves the Lunar shuttle from it's mission to Mars. Once the shuttle is inside, things go bad and there is an unexplained explosion on the Space Station

Xaviar's Institute for Higher Learning- Logan is awaken by someone ringing the school's doorbell. He soon learns its The Fantastic Four wishing to speak to Xaviar and his team of X-men. After a brief fight, that comes about over miscommunication Emma brings the two teams to the living room. There Reed explains that the Simulacra crew is missing and wishes to use Cerebra to contact them. Emma informs him that Cerebra would not reach into space, but Cyclops proposes another option. A team of six takes the X-men Blackbird into space and rescue the crew. Wolverine, Emma, Nightcrawler, The Thing, Sue Storms and Gambit are chosen for the mission and head to the Simulacra

Outer space- Emma senses that there are six people alive on the space station, but they are terrified. The team decides to board the station, and are quickly ambushed by the Brood.
name: First Contact, Part 1

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: The X-Men and the Fantastic Four have gone into space, and found some very scary stuff. But the real threat to their mission might just be among themselves!
name: First Contact, Part 2

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: It’s the X-Men and Fantastic Four versus...the X-Men and Fantastic Four?! An unexpected adversary turns Marvel’s two greatest hero families against one another.
name: First Contact, Part 3

description: The Brood attack! It’s an alien invasion as the Brood crash-land in the middle of Times Square, and only the combined might of the X-Men and Fantastic Four have any chance of stopping them!
name: First Contact, Part 4

description: The climactic battle — will the combined might of the Earth’s two greatest super hero families be enough to save Manhattan — and the world — from total annihilation? The X-Men and FF do their final face-off against the alien Brood!
name: First Contact, Part 5

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: A thousand years ago, four planetary systems were utterly destroyed by an alien force. Since then, humans have moved into space colonies and developed humanoid weapons known as Goddesses to defend their last remaining home planet. Five young boys are caught up in the drive to provide worthy pilots to the defense program and must learn to overcome their differences for their sake, and the sake of all mankind.
name: Vol. 1

description: After logging many hours of demanding physical training, Zero and his classmates finally get to test their piloting skills. Enter Kizna Towry, Zero's new partner, who is charged with maintaining and repairing Zero's Pro-Ings. Kizna is also a bit sensitive, and Zero doesn't help matters when he makes a comment about her feline ears. Can the unlikely duo save mankind in the middle of a dog-eat-dog world?
name: Vol. 2

description: Zero and his classmates are assigned their own Pro-Ings and, to help them get used to piloting them, are each paired up with one of the top five candidates at G.O.A. and assigned to two-on-two battles. Zero is paired with Erts Virny Cocteau, the cream of the crop, and the two of them become good friends. During their battle with Clay and Aracd Narocke, Zero has a strange vision involving...Kizna!?
name: Vol. 3

description: Friendly as ever, Hiead and Zero get into yet another fight and are put in a detention room that suppresses EX to think about what they've done. Meanwhile, Ernest's concern for fellow pilot Gareas grows as he becomes increasingly reckless in battle. The problem only escalates when the pilots are forced into a battle with thousands of Giseisha.
name: Vol. 4

description: When Zero and the rest of the candidates progress to Class Two, Clay is faced with the possibility of expulsion. Meanwhile, some students at G.O.A. mysteriously go MIA. Are the disappearances linked with most recent Giseisha attack?
name: Vol. 5

description: Comic designed to get young people interested in attending the Brick Computer Science Institute.

Captain Glory, one of the greatest and most respected war leaders of the Secret City, has emerged from the Triad Cell and must now fulfill his ultimate mission-- to save modern mankind from the doom that destroyed Gazra 15,000 years ago.  He soon discovers that this mission has taken a terrible new twist.  A small group of the Ninth Men, led by General Ordis, have also survived.  But instead of helping, they seek to brutally conquer mankind and install themselves as the new rulers of Earth!  Unless Captain Glory can first find and then join forces with Night Glider and Bombast, General Ordis will plunge mankind into a new dark age!  This issue includes an exclusive Captain Glory Kirbychrome trading card.
name: The Power And The Glory

description:
CAPTAIN STONEHEART as he was known by tremblin ol Sea Dogs, was a Savage Nightmare of a Beast, feared not just for his Sword or his Ship or his Might, but most especially for his Temper. But as Water twists and turns on its way out to Sea, so did the bitter Captain s life, the Day he set Eyes on the TRUTH FAIRY...

BEN 10 creator Joe Kelly and X-MEN artist Chris Bachalo craft a grim but beautiful tale of Broken Bones and Broken Hearts, featuring characters created for Richard Starkings' ELEPHANTMEN series.
name: HC

volume.name: Captain Stoneheart and the Truth Fairy

description: Within this comic is Chapter Zero: Sewer Line and Chapter One: Groovy Graveyard Part One.

Continuing Mike Carey's acclaimed run on HELLBLAZER, BLACK FLOWERS rachets up the suspense as Constantine begins to see — and battle — the signs of a coming apocalypse in the stories "The Game of Cat and Mouse," the 2-part "Black Flowers" and the 3-part "Third Worlds" from issues #181-186.
name: TPB

volume.name: Capitan Miki & Il Grande Blek Gigante
Capitan Miki & Il Grande Blek Gigante

description:
Contains 3 stories: 
- Un Incarico Pericoloso 
- I Sicari di Landers 
- Un Testimone Ostinato
name: Un Incarico Pericoloso

description:
Contains 3 stories: 
- Il Coyote Nero 
- Attentato a S. Rafael 
- Il Crepaccio Tragico
name: Il Coyote Nero

description:
Contains 3 stories: 
- Il Rapimento di Rita Desmond 
- Il Pazzo del Monte Superstizione 
- Old Pawne Bill
name: Il Rapimento di Rita Desmond

description:
Contains 3 stories: 
- Pat l'Irlandese 
- Un Incontro Fuori Programma 
- Un Barman Sfortunato
name: Pat l'Irlandese

description:
Contains 3 stories: 
- Attacco al Ranch 
- La Carica di Pat 
- Tex Chiude il Conto
name: Attacco al Ranch
